titleStmt.title: Ienny, Ienny; or, The false hearted knight, and kind hearted lass. He wooed fair Jenny, but he would not be wed, he only sued to get her maiden-head, which having got, he did poor Jenny flight, and left her like a false disloyal knight, now she that was in hopes to be a lady, hath time enough to sing ba low my baby. To a new Scotch tune: or; Jenny, Jenny, &c.

publicationStmt.publisher: Printed for F. Coles, T. Vere, J. Wright, and J. Clarke,

notesStmt.note: Verse: "There was a lass in our town ..."
Imperfect: cropped, with loss of imprint.
Reproduction of original in the British Library.
